title: Create comprehensive code search documentation
description:
Document code search tools and create usage guides.

## Objective
Provide clear documentation for all code search tools and their usage patterns.

## Deliverables

### 1. Update docs/tools.md
- Add 'Code Search Tools' section
- Document each tool with examples
- Explain when to use which tool
- Performance characteristics

### 2. Create docs/guides/code-search.md
- Comprehensive guide to code search
- Common use cases and patterns
- Language support matrix
- Troubleshooting guide
- Performance tips

### 3. Update README.md
- Add code search to feature list
- Brief examples in Quick Start
- Link to detailed docs

### 4. SDK Integration Guide
- Example code for using search tools
- Integration patterns
- Custom approval providers for search
- Risk level considerations

### 5. API Documentation
- Docstrings for all tools
- Parameter descriptions
- Return value formats
- Error handling

## Content Outline

### Code Search Tools

**grep_search** - Fast text-based search
- Use for: Simple string/regex patterns
- Speed: Very fast (<1s typical)
- Requires: ripgrep (optional)

**search_code_structure** - AST-based search
- Use for: Finding functions, classes, symbols
- Speed: Fast with cache (<5s typical)
- Requires: grep-ast, tree-sitter

**find_symbol_references** - Reference finder
- Use for: Find all usages of a symbol
- Speed: Medium (<3s per symbol)
- Requires: grep-ast, tree-sitter

### Language Support
| Language | grep_search | code_structure | references |
|----------|-------------|----------------|------------|
| Python   | ✅          | ✅             | ✅         |
| JS/TS    | ✅          | ✅             | ✅         |
| Go       | ✅          | ✅             | ✅         |
| Rust     | ✅          | ✅             | ✅         |
| Java     | ✅          | ✅             | ⚠️         |

## Acceptance Criteria
- All tools documented
- Examples tested and working
- Language support clear
- Performance expectations set
- Troubleshooting covered

4-6 hours
